attributes.action: Tougher enforcement and higher fines for illegal dumping in Manchester.
attributes.additional_details: We are residents of Henderson street in Manchester who have  had to put up with businesses and landlords  who are illegally dumping their waste in our bins and creating a major health hazard, we not only feel this is an ongoing issue for us but also a major issue for many residents beyond levenshulme and Burnage and for the residents of other areas in Manchester too.
attributes.background: Tougher enforcement and higher fines for businesses and Landlords who think they are above the law

rejection.details:
Decisions about local enforcement of fines for illegal waste disposal is a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also petition your local council directly. Find out how to petition your council here: https://democracy.manchester.gov.uk/mgEPetitionListDisplay.aspx?bcr=1

We could accept a petition calling for the UK Government to increase penalties for fly tipping across the country, if that's what you want to happen.
